hints.content: The mass of the mouse is $\greenD{25}$ grams.
The mass of the squirrel is $\maroonD{255}$ grams.

We can find how much less the mass of the mouse is by subtracting the mass of mouse $(\greenD{25}\text{ g})$ from the mass of the squirrel $(\maroonD{255}\text { g})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 255. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Squirrel. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The shorter left part is labeled 25. The longer right part is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the shorter left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Mouse. A curved bracket across the longer right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Difference. !

hints.content: The mouse's mass is $230$ grams less than the squirrel's mass.

question.content:
A mouse and squirrel each found their mass (shown below) for the Forest Friends Wrestling Tournament.

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

**How much less is the mass of the mouse than the squirrel?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 1]] grams

options.alt: A hanging scale weighing a mouse with a starting tick mark of 0 grams and the additional 5 tick marks labeled 50, 100, 150, 200, and 250. There are 9 unlabeled tick marks between every 2 labeled tick marks. The mass of the mouse on the scale is at the fifth unlabeled tick mark after tick mark labeled 0. !

A hanging scale weighing a squirrel with a starting tick mark of 0 grams and the additional 5 tick marks labeled 50, 100, 150, 200, and 250. There are 9 unlabeled tick marks between every 2 labeled tick marks. The mass of the squirrel on the scale is at the first unlabeled tick mark after tick mark labeled 250. !
